intro: Oxygonum auriculatum, commonly known as the auriculate oxeye, is a herbaceous perennial native to the southeastern United States. It features showy yellow flowers with white markings, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. The plant has finely dissected, fern-like leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Its distinctive ear-shaped leaf lobes give it its scientific name, auriculatum.
